tn.text: This begins a list of the names of people who returned from the exile.
This is an idiom that refers to traveling toward Jerusalem. AT: "returned" or "came back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Seraiah, Reeliaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, and Baanah
tn.text: These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the list of the names of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Parosh ... Shephatiah ... Arach ... Pahath Moab ... Jeshua
tn.text: These are men's names.  (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the list of the names of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are men's names.  (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the list of the names of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are men's names.  (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a man's name Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:01|2:02]].
This continues the list of the names of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are men's names. (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
eight** - "98" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This continues the list of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group. Notice that staring in 2:21 these now are the names of places from where they originally came. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are men's names. (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
five ... fifty-six** - "95 ... 56" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This begins to list the number of people whose ancestors had lived in towns in Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a town in Judah. (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the list people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group whose ancestors came from the places listed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Anathoth ... Azmaveth ... Kiriath Arim ... Chephirah ... Beeroth ... Geba
tn.text: names of places (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
two** - "42" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This continues with the list of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group whose ancestors came from the places listed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
names of places (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
two** - "52" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This continues with the list of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group whose ancestors came from the places listed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
names of places (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues with the list of people who returned from the exile along with the number in each group whose ancestors came from the places listed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
the name of a place (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This section lists the names of priests whose descendants returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
men's names (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:03|2:06]].
The "Harim" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:31|2:32]] is the name of a place, but here "Harim" is the name of a man.

This section lists the names of Levites whose descendants returned from the exile along with the number in each group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Kadmiel ... Hodaviah ... Shallum ... Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, and Shobai
tn.text: men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
four** - "74" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
those in charge of who goes through the gates of the temple
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:15|2:16]].
This section continues listing the names of Levites whose descendants returned from the exile.

tn.ref: Ziha, Hasupha, Tabbaoth, Keros, Siaha, Padon, Lebanah, Hagabah ... Hagab, Shalmai, and Hanan
tn.text: men's names (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:40|2:42]].
This section continues listing the names of Levites whose descendants returned from the exile. These are all names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This section continues listing the names of Levites whose descendants returned from the exile. These are all names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This section continues listing the names of Levites whose descendants returned from the exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the number of the all the people in this group who came back from the exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This is a list of people who had returned to Israel from various Babylonian cities but could not prove their heritage. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Tel Melah, Tel Charsha, Kerub, Addan, and Immer
tn.text: places in Babylon that no longer exist (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
the records that told who their ancestors were
"could not find their names in the records of the priests"

tn.ref: they were excluded from the priesthood as unclean
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. The abstract noun "priesthood" can be translated as the verb "work as priests." AT: "the other priests treated them as if they were unclean did not allow them to work as priests" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
not fit to be priests
two items like dice that the priests used to decide what God wanted them to do
the whole group that returned back to the land of Judah from the exile
"their female servants"
"200" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is a list of the animals along with the numbers of each kind that returned with the people from the exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: sixty-one thousand ... five thousand ... one hundred
tn.text: one thousand ... five thousand ... one hundred** - "61,000 ... 5,000 ... 100" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
A "daric" was a small gold coin used by the Persian Empire. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
A mina is a unit of weight. One mina equals 550 grams. Minas are normally linked with measuring silver. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
garments worn next to the skin

tn.ref: All the people in Israel were in their cities
tn.text: Everyone went back to their home towns in Judea. Not everyone resettled in Jerusalem.
